text: was a town located in Mitsu District, Okayama Prefecture, Japan. As of 2003, the town had an estimated population of 6,037 and a density of 42.77 persons per km². The total area was 141.15 km². On October 1, 2004, Kamogawa, along with the town of Kayō (from Jōbō District), was merged to create the town of Kibichūō (in the newly created Kaga District). Category:Dissolved municipalities of Okayama Prefecture
title: Kamogawa, Okayama
